pros: SMT are approachable and always offer a response if ways of working are queried
cons: Slow at implementing new ways of working

pros: approachable manager overtime shifts available if wanted
cons: occasional staff turnover but it's getting better arguably low pay - like everyone's in care

pros: No pros to the company
cons: Staff are a big problem Shift patterns No home life

review_title: Care work is the same everywhere
pros: -Most staff are amazing to work with very supportive. -The service users are very good people.
cons: -The poor pay for the amount of responsibility we’re given -Can’t even have a day off without being rang 20 times by management to cover -Constantly working with agency who don’t want to be there which makes your job difficult because you’re carrying the whole shift on your own and when you complain management doesn’t listen -There’s no alternating weekends, if you volunteer to work a weekend you’re never not working that weekend ever again.

pros: The actual job was great just what I wanted to do help people and improve their lives
cons: The management were awful 😞 Proof of bullying (I had a lady literally ring me up and have a go at me at how I was doing my job but she just got a slap on the wrist) I reported higher up ignored the management actually went to his boss and he still ignored me. Then I ended up off sick for several months because my mental health took a real downturn I was coming back from shifts and crying my eyes out at the unfairness of the whole situation. I had one occasion when they hadn't told a staff member that they were down to do a sleep in shift (she worked in a different service) I rang up on call and basically got told can you wait which I said sure thats fine I can wait till they get someone to come then ended up with me having to do the sleep shift except I legally wasn't allowed to do them because I have hearing aids so I spent the whole night awake because I didn't feel comfortable sleeping as the service user might get up which is why they have sleep ins in the first place. Absolutely no chance of progressing through the ranks because they barely ever advertise the roles that are required within the company and let's face it we are all creatures of habit we don't want to go to other services to work.

pros: Staff work as team dependent on base
cons: Poor management in all departments

pros: Most staff and service users are amazing to work with.
cons: Poor pay for the number of responsibilities of the job Being rang every time on your days off to cover shifts Working with agency workers who have no desire to do their job, so there's more pressure put on you to get so many things done.

job_title: Community Support Worker in Leicester, England
pros: Nice expirence. It was an eye opener
cons: They dont cater to students and expect them to do double the work because they are young

job_title: Care Worker in Sturminster Newton, England
pros: Some staff are great. Residents are lovely
cons: Management shocking, pay is terrible. Training and support is not completed appropriately

pros: You meet and work with lots of interesting service users. It’s good experience.
cons: Leeds Outreach management lack integrity, courage and dynamism, presiding over a culture of blaming ground level staff for service issues. The service is poorly organised, support staff are demoralised, all of which can be evidenced by the high rate of staff turn over. Overworked and mostly ineffective management has inevitably impacted upon the coordination of the support team and the level of care provided. This is a concerning situation for service users without active advocates whose quality of life is being put at risk.

job_title: Divisional Administrator in Shipley, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: People are great. People we support are great. Everyone supports each other.
cons: Can be emotionally draining. No real prospects.

pros: Good and supportive management and service users
cons: Pay and particularly enhancements for bank holidays etc are poor

pros: You get to learn new things
cons: It can be challenging sometimes

pros: Excellent training, consistent one to ones.
cons: Where do I start.. appalling management that should be reported to safeguarding, extremely high staff turn over, poor pay, poor night pay, endless amounts of duplicated paperwork, paperwork not delivered to services, including MAR charts, calls, texts and emails ignored by management, appalling ON call, same people being promoted all the time, It's absolutely disgusting how staff are treated within this organisation.

pros: The people being supported are pretty amazing shame they are not being supported safely or in a person centred way,
cons:
poor training
poor support
poor pay
excessive hours

pros: Understanding manager and flexible shifts.
cons: Staff shortage is always a concern.

review_title: Job is fine, management are not.
pros:
*EMBANKMENT HOUSE*
Decent wage, normal shift patterns
cons: Management patronise staff with different opinions to them. Management been here too long, ‘I’ve been here 10 years’ 10 years too long by all accounts. Needs a change, every issue comes down to the narcissistic management.

review_title: Incredibly toxic environment to work in
pros: The rest of the support staff are amazing and do well in spite of treatment from management
cons: There is absolutely no support for staff if you work here. There's a tendency for staff to feel bullied and pressured into things. When incidents happen management tend to close rank and or cover up the incidents if they are at fault. People who have no experience of the job are promoted to high positions and then abuse their power. Support staff are constantly going sick leave because they are not supported or debriefed about incidents that occur

pros: Absolutely none at all !
cons:
-poor management.

-having to lone work with person supported who is meant to be 2 to 1 due to behaviours.

-night staff not turning up so support staff that have been on 15 hour shifts having to stay until cover is arranged.

-staff members stealing from people supported and nothing done about it.

-no praise or recognition for working hard and covering shifts

-managers allowing members of staff to work a night shift when they have previously been on a late or even sometimes a long day that day.

-no support from management 

-complaints from staff not handled properly 

-whistleblowing is an absolute shambles and it seems that the company will do anything to cover abuse/misconduct up and still have said employees working for the company.

-on top of all of this the pay is shocking for what you have to deal with on a day to day basis and don’t bother thinking about any career or training progression. Dead end job that employees literally anyone they can find.

-If you value your sanity then avoid this company at all costs.

pros: Other than the Support Manager I had before I resigned, who was one of the very few good ones (which unfortunately meant that they were walked all over by upper management and other Support Managers), I honestly cannot recall anything remotely positive about working for Affinity Trust, which is sad
cons:
I'd like to say that I cannot speak for other divisions, only what I have personally witnessed whilst working in Central

- Most people have to wait between 6 to 12 months after commencing employment to receive basic training
- Inadequate support given for employees of all levels, primarily Support Workers
- Management very clique-y
- Rather than address problems at the root, a "no collusion" rule was implemented in an effort to quash talks of staff mistreatment
- Totally inflexible with shifts on the rota
- Unless you are older or a parent, you are essentially harrassed to pick up shifts, this includes multiple phone calls to personal phones when the employee is off shift
- Unbearable pressure is placed on staff with more experience because they had to pick up all the extra slack from those less experienced (as in, staff that had not received any training whatsoever and were essentially shift fillers to avoid action from the Council and CQC). This almost always resulted in staff burnout, mental health issues, sickness and serious mistakes being made that could have been avoided if they had just been treated like human beings. Instead, the staff were blamed and punished for such mistakes. Morale was non-existent in any of the services that I worked in

Thankless, low-paying work and one of the worst jobs I have ever had. Working for Affinity Trust really did a number on my mental health

pros:
The management structure, always plenty of support around. People we support have person centred support and are able to do what they want when they want. 
Benefits have gotten better over the last year
cons: It’s the care sector, the cons for here are the same as every care company.

pros:
Affinity give their employees scope to be able to grow within the organisation, they support their employees and deal within concerns quickly and confidentially. 
I have been with them for 2 years and have been supported by both the support staff and management. I would definitely recommend family and friends to work here and would feel confident with the support provided for a family member if needed.
cons: At times there can be a lot of work to juggle in one go but there is always support to get through it

pros:
It’s Flexible
7 hour shifts
Early mornings 
Afternoon s 
Evenings
cons:
Low wage
Too much staff Gossiping

job_title: Support Worker in Ellesmere Port, England
pros: There are some really nice people that actually care for their clients and will go above and beyond (not recognised or appreciated) sick pay is also a bonus
cons: Some work colleagues are really nasty, I have witnessed constant bullying. One of the women has organised a witch hunt against one of the waking night staff. She has been talking about her and telling new starters lies to the extent now that they have joined ranks and they sit around talking about this poor women. They accuse her of sleeping through the night, because she looks like she has woken up when she opens the door. Or she hasn't got tv on or she is lying about client not sleeping cus he does ( sleep fluctuates)All information is untrue but you cannot disagree or this person will call you a liar. This person has made so many allegations against staff and some have left or lost their job due to her lies. She has walked out on shift numerous times, gone home early, washes her hair and puts make up on in work time. She does not complete work, but management let her get away with it. She calls people liars and peados, she is always the victim but good decent people are ignored and not believed by management. If you disagree with her then you are the devil, she is not a victim but the abuser. Higher management are happy to listen to her. I am watching and waiting for this poor women who is being bullied to be sacked then these colleagues will have too find their next victim and hope it is not one of them.

pros: There were no pros for working with the company
cons: The company is a terrible place to work

job_title: Support Worker in Luton, South West England, England
pros: Great team work and supportive staff
cons: Sometimes allocation of rota is not favorable for all

job_title: Care Assistant in Sturminster Newton, England
pros: The job is variable depending who your supporting. Can be challenging but very enjoyable too. Rewarding company to work with, lots of support to climb up the ladder. Only been with them since January but lots of opportunities to shine!
cons: Hours can be long but not strenuous. Need to do sleep ins and possible waking nights too.

job_title: Support Worker in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: The people we support are lovely
cons: Management do not listen, you don't count, you are just a number, often told if you don't like or agree with anything you can leave.

pros: The service users are amazing
cons: Staffing levels could be better

job_title: Support Worker in Sturminster Newton, England
pros:
Lovely place to work 
Great team and management 
Great environment 
Great support team nothing is to small always willing to help when they can.
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Really cares about our mental and physical well-being, qualifications (lots of training and reviews)
cons: Honestly the only disadvantage is a minimum wage. It is very responsible job that we do and it requires a lot of mental energy.

job_title: Manager in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Company benefits include competitive salary & wellbeing service
cons: None found while I have worked here

pros: Good salary & food rate for sleep overs
cons: Long shift & can be called in at last minute

pros: Good levels of caring and understanding
cons: All has been well so far

job_title: Disability Support Worker in Tipton, England
pros: Flexible working hours. Good sick pay entitlement
cons: The Pay isn't very good

pros: the amazing people i supported
cons: a total lack of communication

review_title: Senior Management getting it all wrong
pros: Training was excellent. I loved working with the people we support. My local  colleagues were supportive (even though over stretched). Some head office teams were helpful such as the training department and the IT department. Thats it .
cons:
I will go in order getting worse. 

Senior Management are out of touch and are getting it wrong. Redundancies happen, but there is no need to treat it as part of everyday life when people are struggling t cope with workload already. We are felt as if we were not important. 

Staff are leaving because they feel worthless. Introducing a Refer a Friend scheme will not fix that. Employing a person to 'engage' us will not fix that. Start listening. 

You did a survey - pointless. Anything done now will be too late as everyone left. (Management would read it wrong anyway).

The people we support do not feel like they are the heart of the organisation anymore, it feels like Carista is. Its become unbearable. 

Rotas are planned around favoritism. No consistency and no thoughts of getting a staff balance. DDs should be reinforcing this. In fact DDs should be the ones 'engaging' us and showing us we matter. 

Errors are happening in services regarding different things (meds, recording etc) but are being glazed over. 

Honestly this list could go on forever.

review_title: Fantastic Organisation doing some sterling work.
pros:
Approximately eight years ago I decided I needed a career change (Car Mechanic/Driver) I was lucky enough to be taken on as a support worker in the Cambridgeshire area. Through a wealth of first class training and support from those around and above me and following multiple promotions I am currently employed as a Support Manager . I have always been encouraged to develop my skills, as a result of the support I have received I have achieved PROACT SCIPr-UK instructor Status.
I genuinely believe that the work my colleagues and I carry out is amongst the most important within the world health and social care.
As stated in the title; Affinity Trust are a fantastic organisation doing some sterling work.
All of the individuals I have been lucky to support during my time will go through lives ups and downs. I am confident that the work Affinity Trust carries out will enable those individuals to throw back a little of what life throws at them.
Come and give us a try.
cons: The financial constraints that are present in the world of health and social care are the only con I have experienced in my time to date.

pros: The clients we support- I would not carry on working if it was not for the work relationships I have built with them and the fact I feel I am one of few staff that deep down care for the clients
cons:
No staff induction 
Seem to employ young or unexperienced staff with no support to guide them 
If staff shortage you are expected to get on with it- example four staff suppose to be on shift, I was left by myself for an hour and affinity bank staff who had never worked within the home. 
Made numerous concerns to my manager but they are never dealt with 
Tried to phone management for support and no response from them 
Being told that clients must do their activities but how can they with no staff 
Just feel there is no support from management 
Management make the choice for the clients- they don't care about the clients 
Management really do not know the clients and their support needs 
Management make it obvious which staff they favour 
Rotas- some months I work nearly every weekend and then I have two weekends of in a row
Constant phone calls for covering shifts

review_title: Kick in the teeth pay rise
pros: Good only if you have adequate team work & team leaders who are willing to listen
cons:
To many Bank Staff who think they come to work to do as little as possible, has been on going for years & they put up with them just to cover shifts.
Been here for over 4 years & they take away the yearly bonus we used to get & replace it with a 1% pay rise the only pay rise some workers have had in 7 years, could of still gave a bonus this year at least totally outrageous this works out being less than the bonus essentially saying to workers put more hours in if you want more money. Following with insult to injury it then stated on the letter how much they appreciate the hard work we do which if they have forgot was on the basic minimum wage !

Totally having a laugh because how much you pay employees shows how if you are valued at your job !!!

pros: Those we support are at the very core of the company  Teams are amazing and I am proud to support them and the organisation.
cons:
It is a challenging time and the swell of bad press on here isn't helping. 
Playground bullys not getting thier own way sending anonymous threats and posting on reviews such as this to destroy the reputation of an organisation

job_title: Support Manager in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros:
Very good training and support from managers towards staff, which in turn gives the people we support fantastic lives. Many staff have worked in their role for years, providing consistency and great support. 
Negative comments on here are often from ex employees with a grudge,  some of whom  have been 'let go' which proves the policies in place for managing unsuitable staff do work. Neither me nor my colleagues 'bully' staff and are supportive as much as we can within policy guidelines,  as they  are our biggest asset and without them could not continue our good work. We have people applying to work with us as they have heard of our good reputation
cons: The wage is consistent with the industry 'norm' which should be higher, however, local commissioners are not offering the money to offer higher wages. AT have committed to the living wage though

pros:
There are so many. If you are considering a job in care then this is the charity organisation for you.  There is so much scope to learn and progress here.

People we support are put in the centre of what we do
Managers will listen and be supportive 
Senior managers have a good presence 
Good ethos and values 
Not driven by money!!
Good development opportunities
Great training 
An organisation that is always trying to improve itself for the better and not loosing sight of whats important ... the people we support 
Always paid on time
Good communication ... it’s a two way street 
All departments are very responsive 

Come and see for yourself!
cons: The organisation is great and has the right way of thinking, this really shows through at every level from managers to support workers.

review_title: No support and management don’t listen
pros: Best thing about working at Affinity Trust is the people I supported and some of my colleagues. Made some good friends and had some amazing experiences
cons:
No support from management or appreciation for the things staff do. This includes staying late at short notice, overtime, decorating people’s homes or sorting out the stuff other staff have left. 

Think carefully before applying to this service

job_title: Community Support Worker in Glasgow, Scotland
pros: The only reason to work for them is the PWS.
cons: The management is a joke, they don't care about their staff and when you pass on issues regarding PWS they are rarely dealt with. There is a culture of favoritism that runs through the office I work in. Gross misconduct is swept under the carpet and some staff seems to get away with whatever they want and still have a job. If you're looking for work-life balance don't think that you will get it unless your face fits regardless of your personal circumstances. There is much more I could say about this company but to be honest it would breach confidentiality.

job_title: Team Leader in Shipley, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: I have worked for affinity trust coming up 4 years now with no sick days in which i recieved a letter thanking me which i appreciated and in the last month have changed from support worker to team leader. I love my job before and after the change i have always been supported by support manager and also operations manager who are all so open and supportive and helped me grow to be able to become a team leader. I have a great team around me in other team leaders and also support workers. Hands down best company i have ever worked for. Look forward to my future there.
cons: I have never had any issues.

pros: This is an excellent organisation for whether your starting out in the vocation of supporting individuals with learning disabilities, or you are a seasoned professional. The training, guidance and management are encouraging and friendly. All your suggestions and positive constructive feedback to improve the service and organisation are viewed and taken into consideration. Plenty of opportunities to progress.
cons: In times of austerity the pay is minimum wage for a support worker, but I'm sure it will be made competitive when the trust hopefully gains more business and contracts to it's hopefully expanding portfolio.

job_title: Support Worker in Shipley, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros:
Brilliant staff teams
Fantastic line management and support/ Always approachable
Excellent training program
People we support are put in the centre of what we do
Good ethos and values
I love my job and i am just as enthusiastic as the first day i started. i enjoy going to work.
i havent had a day off sick since i started here and it was nice to recieve a letter from the area manager to thank me for being consistant- which was appriciated
cons: none to comment about here, i cannot fault them .

pros: I was able to support people to achieve the best the could with the little resources we had. My team mates are excellent and I have made lifelong friends there. Where I worked was not a far commute and had a good bus route for me with other services not too far away from them.
cons: Management. It all went down hill in early 2018 when our senior manager left. She was current and didn’t care for people who didn’t want to support people properly and with respect. There was none of this not getting rid of poor staff for abuse because of retribution. Great manager and a real loss to the company. Nowadays it’s just negative and low with morale with no umph from anyone with any authority.

pros: Training is good and it is nice to help the people we support but not a lot else to be honest.
cons: Utter chaos. If people aren't fit for their role they are moved to other services under the guise of "wanting a new challenge." No support when people are challenging. Staff members allowed to get away with murder.  No real leadership and total lack of regard for employees. Made to work with people that have requested they don't want your gender working with them. Told a month or so back not to leave reviews online and instead talk to management but they do nothing about any complaints.

job_title: Support Worker in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: the service users and helping them to achieve things in life .
cons: Past pay cuts , Rubbish pay rises but not every year some years just a small bonus , no rewards for loyalty or long service , The joke 10% weekend enhancement  on your hourly rate , The flat rate overtime rate(I,E nothing) this company is all about box ticking and making out everything is wonderful with its highly trained staff lots of glossy spin and creating a rosy picture the reality is staff are demoralised and nobody from the top down seems to have a clue about why the high staff turnover or conveniently pretend its the same at all care companies..

pros: Excellent training and some very dedicated support workers.
cons:
So many..
No staff support, extremely poor management, safeguarding/cqc issues, not person centered,  poor pay, horrendous hours, staff are at risk of burnout, health and safety issues, lack of enthusiasm from managers/teamleaders around company values and ethos,  no rotas, out of date support plan/risk assessments, don't trust the whistle blowing policy they will break confidentiality,  too much office time for managers, Upper senior management is extremely weak, you have a massive staff turn over, lack of staff meetings, supervisions....I could go on all day.

pros:
Staff and pws
When it's time to go home
cons:
Poor management skills
Harassment from management

pros:
Fantastic Staff Teams 
Putting Person Centred Approaches First
Company Progression and Training Excellent 
Good Line Management and lots of support
Positive Change throughout my 4 years of service and it is a company for life as what we do in my opinion is first class after lots of experience working for different providers
Intelligent thought process and real problem solving
cons:
Work Load can at times be daunting 
Induction Process Could be Smoother 
Not being located next to my services can at times hinder what I achieve and affect my ability to get around the services although I can manage this

pros: Excellent training and that's pretty much it.
cons: Poor management,  lack of support, poor pay, expectation to work well over your contracted hours so staff are at risk of burn out.

review_title: Work and life at Affinity Trust
pros: Great people we support and always a pleasure to come to work to make a difference - great staff team and dedicated staff who want to do the best
cons:
At times the focus is not on the people we support but meeting targets and deadlines 
Management are supportive but faced with their own targets - plenty of management presence 
Pay and conditions need to be reviewed to attract more staff and avoid shifts with agency.

pros: I do enjoy work for Affinity, i can do as many overtimes as i would like to, In case of any problems or questions, my Team Leader Holly  is always ready to help me. Company makes sure their staff is well prepared for this job and trainings are always up to date.  I would recommend Affinity to my Friends.
cons: not all staff is always reliable . Needed to do unplanned overtime as my colleague didnt turn up

pros:
Affinity Trust is an excellent employer, the best employer I have had in the social care industry. The company values are really driven into the support and there is a genuine effort to improve services offered across the board.
The staff at all levels have been caring people for the most part, and I have felt as though my team and more senior managers have 'had my back' even in tough situations.
I recommend this company to anyone who has a caring nature and wants to make a difference in the lives of the people that receive their services
cons: I can think of nothing significant

pros:
An organisation with positive values who place the people we support at the centre. I have had good, strong leadership from my line manager from the start of my employment which is one of the many reasons I have chosen to remain with Affinity Trust. 
Like in most jobs you have good days and not so good days but when I visit the people supported, observe the positive outcomes and the support delivered by the support workers it really brings a smile to my face.
cons: I do not have negative comments.

pros: I have bonded so well and been accepted by the people I support
cons: With the latest pay rise of 1% I simply cant afford to stay working here, Which will be sad not only for the people I support but for me too,  As the people I support in a sense validate myself as a human being....Think about it ........

pros: Supportive manager, good training, could do my Lwvel 3, lovely people we support,  felt really supported to do a good job by the new ops manager who has dealt with some issues that made the job better as involved in discussions about changes and new ways of workin
cons: Pay is still not great

review_title: Quick gains if you can hack it
pros: Good team, got your back, thinking on your feet, caring and sharing.
cons: Detached management, no guidance, no direction at ground level but plenty as a company, which we find out about after the event.

pros: the people we support, some staff
cons: where do i start, i have been with the company for more than five years and this is the worst it's been, if you make a complaint about agency staff they won't believe you and will take the side of the agency even if the agency staff threaten you and your'e family, i have lost faith in management and they turn things around to make it your fault

pros: Promoting from within, training is very good, quality assurance processes good, some highly dedicated staff that are longing to be recognised for the flexibility they show every day.
cons:
Focus taken away from people supported over last few years. Quality of support measured by sitting in an office looking for a green tick on a computer screen.
Extremely high turnover both at support worker level but also management despite being competitive on pay and benefits. Have to ask yourself why? On call is extremely stressful.

job_title: Residential Support Worker in Reading, England
pros:
PWS deserve BETTER
THE MINORITY OF GOOD HARDWORKING STAFF DESERVE BETTER!
cons:
-Absolutely horrible power hungry management with no respect for staff.
-Lazy employees get the most praise.
-PWS spitting swearing at you, and management do not let you outline their awful behaviours in CAREPLANS.. it is all sugar coated to look good on documentation . 
Staff can not exercise basic -time out- to PWS as management will look in and SAY "HEY THATS ABUSE'. so BEING FIRM AND SAYING to PWS 'FOR UR AWFUL BEHAVIOUR AND SPITTING ON STAFF U HAVE time out and inreturn LOST UR ACTIVITY FOR TODAY SO U CAN REFLECT ON UR BEHAVIOUR'. - IT IS ABUSE? SO WE on day to day basis OYR ROLE IS TO HAVE TO SUPPORT, MOTIVATE, STIMULATE AND ENCOURAGE NEW SKILLS BEHAVIOURS ROUTINES ETC BUT ACCORDING TO MANAGEMENT when we ARE THEN ABUSED?? WE R PAID FOR JOB THEREFORE WE SHOULD GET SPAT ON AND ABUSED AND KEEP MOUTH SHUT and not even able to educate PWS on basic manners.. WHICH IN RETURN LEADS TO MORE BEHAVIOURS THAT CHALLENGE and makes OUR JOB DIFFUCULT.  It is not (PWS FAULT, it is management fault for turning around on staff and making staff deal with horrible behaviours FROM PWS and saying you not allowed to say nothing at all because they r adult they can do what they want) i wonder what management would do if they got spat by PWS? SURELY THEY WOULD VOCALISE THAT IT IS NOT ACCEPTABLE? RIGHT? BUT WHEN STAFF DO.. Oh IT IS FORM OF ABUSE! VERY minipulating company. BUT EVEN U TEACH UR PET ANIMALS HOW TO BEHAVE, BUT SOME REASON WE R NOT ALLOWED TO VOCALISE basic human manners. its awful awful AWFUL AWFUL company. TOOOO MUCH AWFUL.

pros:
I have been working with Affinity Trust for a few years ago and they are the best support provider I have worked for.

Support Manager is great and is always there if I need support. 

I enjoy the training courses.  I love working with the people we support.
cons: Not a fan of the online training. Low rate of pay.

pros: Lovely clients with specialist needs and it is very rewarding to look after them knowing you have gone the extra mile for their benefit
cons:
More being a nurse than support worker
Not enough time to do everything expected on shift
Too much paperwork / computer work / left to run the house with no managers around, so staff have to deal with everything
Rota 's a mess, staff leaving as burnt out

pros: Not as many as there should be for a 'care' company! The people we support are great and some of the training is good.
cons: Management don't care about the staff teams or the hours we are forced to work. Management don't listen and only care about expanding as quickly as possible.

pros: I started 6 months ago so did my manager, she was so helpful and kind could always go to her for help. Very sad  Annemarie she's left the region.
cons: Sad my manager Annemarie left the region as she is such a lovely lady, I hope she will come back to our region ☺

review_title: Not at all good. In fact totally disgusting
pros: Wish I could find something positive
cons: If the upper management were pulled out and professional people were put in it may be better.

review_title: Tact was a great company until it turned into affinity trust  seems as if you get on with your work
pros: Very good training and some nice people who work at the pit face
cons: Management not supportive rather finish you than support you if you worked lots of hours and was a yes person you were fine great staff from the old tack company but new management don't listen

pros: Plenty of shifts due to high turnover
cons: The management are unhelpful, spitefull and useless. Staff are treated like replaceable pawns and morale is extremely low because of this. Nice staff team, however team leaders of the Dunstable  services make it difficult for staff to enjoy their time at work. I would advise any applicants to avoid this company at all costs.

pros: We get paid on time
cons: Recent reorganisation has been a disaster. It was bad before but is now a laughing stock.Our recruitment plan is to pay staff to recommend a friend.

pros: helpful staff good on the job training ive been made to feel most welcome and had the chance to see the day to day life for the people we look after
cons: Working unsociable hours, but this is part of the job.

pros:
Hard working staff
good work environment
cons:
Lack of structure 
Organisational and management issues
Under staffed services 
Low pay
Long unsociable hours

review_title: No support from Team leaders  when needed in a challenging situation. They keep saying phone support but thats not good

pros: Training generally well structured but always take your own, dont even get coffees,tea or soft drinks.

review_title: Be Prepared to find other employment

pros: There are some great members of staff that truly care about the PWS and go out their way for others.
cons: Poor management, clicks of races and age groups. individually people are nice however, as a whole this company has the worst morale and team ethic I have witnessed. people are often in clicks and so much work place bullying is often seen.

pros: lovely client group , regular training

pros: Nothing other organisations don't offer.
